thread.title: Watch live: 4A/5A girls soccer state championships at Rio Tinto Stadium
thread.title_full: Watch live: 4A/5A girls soccer state championships at Rio Tinto Stadium

title: Watch live: 4A/5A girls soccer state championships at Rio Tinto Stadium
text:
 
SANDY — All season, the Davis girls soccer team could rely on its offense to overwhelm teams through Region 2 play and beyond. 
When it got down to the state playoffs, however, the Darts (20-0) had to win another way: with defense. 
An offense that scored 100 goals in the regular season en route to a perfect record and Region 2 title has made it back to the Class 5A state championship at Rio Tinto Stadium, thanks largely to a defensive effort that has allowed only eight goals on the year, outscoring opponents 8-1 in the postseason. 
"The old adage that defense wins championship is 100 percent true. It's especially true in the playoffs, where these games are really tight, and you see that happen," Davis coach Souli Phongsavath said. "Our defense has been strong this whole time; they've kept us in games when our offense hasn't been in a rhythm or we haven't been as clinical in our finishing as we should be. We know we wouldn't be anywhere close to where we are now without our defense." 
Davis will try to defend its 5A state title against upstart Weber, the second seed from Region 1 that knocked off last year's state runner-up Lone Peak via penalty shootout, at 7 p.m. at Rio Tinto Stadium. 
Watch the game via the video embedded above, or at live.ksl.com . 
In Class 4A, Skyline and Timpanogos meet for the third-straight time in the championship match. The Eagles (17-1-1) are looking for their first win over the two-time defending state champion Timberwolves (9-5-3) in that span.
